column1: good length ball on middle stump at 123 kph, defended on the back foot to short midwicket.
short of a length on off stump, goes back to flick behind square with ease.
short of a length angled down leg, Rohit is late on the pull but wide called.
short of a length on fifth stump, Rohit goes back and punches but straight to cover point.

hammered! A fraction short on off stump at just 130 kph, sits up for Rohit to lace a blistering pull over square leg. Flat, didn't go more than 15 meters in the air but clears that short boundary landing at 62 meters over the rope. It took India until the 50th over to hit their first six v England, but they've done it on the fourth legal ball today!
good length ball on fifth stump, goes back and across to defend firmly back toward extra cover.
fullish length on fourth stump, Rohit uses his feet to step down and flick through midwicket for an easy pair.
good length ball at 128 kph/79 mph pitching on fourth stump, Rahul goes back to defend. No sign of any real swing from either bowler as yet.
good length ball on off stump, goes back to defend to point.
fullish length on fifth stump and finally a hint of swing moving away, Rahul shoulders arms.
overpitched on fourth stump at 122 kph/75 mph, driven firmly but straight to mid-off.
short of a length on off stump, Rahul shuffles across and back to punch back down the pitch as Saifuddin fields moving to his right.
overpitched and angled into leg stump at 126 kph/78 mph, Rahul flicks off his pads through square leg to deny a maiden.
short of a length pitching on middle and angled across, Rahul goes back and dangles the bat with a slightly open face to chop this down to third man.
good length ball angled across fourth stump, Rohit tries to tap and run gently pushing into short midwicket but Mustafizur hustles to field in his follow-through to deny it.
good length ball angled across fifth stump, left alone comfortably.
good length ball pitching on off stump at 129 kph/80 mph and continuing on with the angle, defended back down the pitch.
short of a length on the hips, Rohit paddle/short-arm jab pulls this behind square, short fine leg shuffles left to field off one bounce.
short of a length on fifth stump line, tapped behind point for a simple single to third man.
good length ball on fifth stump, left alone.
good length and tighter on a fourth stump line at 129 kph/80 mph, tentative poke by Rahul moving back with a touch of swing too.
good length again on fifth stump, Rahul moves across to cover the line and slaps back down the pitch.
fullish length but very wide outside off, goes to drive through cover but miscues to extra cover.

shocking misfield by Shakib. Good length but straying on the legs, flicked off his thigh through midwicket, Shakib at deep square takes a horrendous angle trying to cut two into a single and instead turned it into a boundary diving over the top of the ball in the end.
full length on off stump, mishits this off the pads back to Saifuddin.
fullish length on fourth stump, driven hard to extra cover.
good length ball on middle stump angled across, Rohit goes back to defend to cover.
fullish length ball on fourth stump, driven firmly but straight to cover point.

dropped! Clumsy from Tamim! Short ball from Mustafizur on fourth stump, sucker ball really with Rohit aiming for the short boundary having hit a six over square leg in the first over. He doesn't get the elevation or timing on this, it hangs in the air for Tamim running to his left from deep square leg. He covers 15 yards and slows down his jog to steady himself but shells it badly at chest height. 4/10 on degree of difficulty but he spilled it badly.
good length on the legs, off the pads missing a flick and dribbles behind square for a run.
good length on off stump, clipped through midwicket.
beaten! Fullish length on fifth stump, Rohit drives away from his body and is beaten for pace.
full on fourth stump, flicked to mid-on.
smoked! In the slot on fourth stump, Rohit shimmies down the track and slams a drive 20 yards into the stands over extra cover.
good length ball on the hips, tucked off the pads behind square.
fullish length on the pads angling down leg stump, whipped wide of midwicket.
full on off stump, driven hard but straight to extra cover.

slashed wide of slip! Mustafizur draws him into a drive with a fullish length ball angled across fifth stump. Rohit throws the bat at it and slices it but comfortably wide of the catching man and it goes fine of third man.
good length ball on middle and leg, defended back down the pitch.
good length ball on leg stump, clipped with ease through midwicket.
full on off stump, defended on the front foot back to Mustafizur.
full on middle, tapped gently into midwicket and wide enough of the fielder for a safe run.
good length ball angled across off stump, chipped to midwicket but can't pick the gap.
good length but straying on the legs, clipped through to the leg side sweeper.
short and wide, guided to third man.
poor ball from Saifuddin. Full and angled well down leg, Rahul helps himself at the breakfast buffet with a flick past the keeper. Fine leg in the ring so no chance.
glorious! Overpitched in the slot outside off, Rahul caresses this between mid-off and extra cover. India humming. Bangladesh playing catch up.
short on the stumps, goes to pull but mistimes this into the ground off a bottom edge and it trickles toward square leg.
overpitched on middle stump, Rahul pirouettes a KP-esque flamingo flick through the leg side.
full on middle, shuffles across to flick through midwicket.
fullish length, Rohit with a sizzling drive on the up beats a despairing dive at extra cover from Sabbir going right and it keeps bouncing away.
full and very very wide outside off, Rohit stabs a drive that clears backward point, Saifuddin with a poor effort at third man is slow moving to his right and can't cut it off.
good length ball angled onto middle stump, defended into the leg side.
short of a length on off, defended again to Soumya at midwicket.
short of a length on off stump, tapped softly off the back foot into square leg, wide enough of short midwicket to rotate the strike.
good length ball on fourth stump, guided with soft hands to third man.
overpitched dolly at 122 kph on fifth stump, step down the track and flicked wristily in the air just wide of Mashrafe to his left, beats mid-off with ease.
good length ball on fifth stump, defended to backward point.
short of a length ball on middle, goes back to tuck this into midwicket.

class! Short of a length ball on fourth stump, not really much width on offer but with third man up in the ring, guides this with timing between third man and backward point, piercing the gap elegantly.
good length ball but straying down leg, clipped behind square to get off strike.
full on fourth stump, presses a drive straight to extra cover.
tossed up, grips a bit, and beats his outside edge as Sharma looks to defend
hangs back and cuts a length ball towards point
tossed up, he looks for the drive, and a bit of extra bounce beats him
floated, goes straight on with the arm, and he drives towards wide cover
floated up, goes on with the arm, and he punches this down to long on
flatter, goes towards the leg side as he looks to flick. Will have to bowl this again
presses forward to defend a length ball on off stump
full, wide, and he spanks this hard towards deep point
length ball, jags back into him from a length, and he defends to point
length, and straightens into him, and he defends this back to the bowler
length, little angle back in to him, and he defends this towards short cover
fuller, and he drives this on the up. Beats Mortaza, but cannot go past mid off
goes back and punches this off the back foot towards midwicket
flighted, and he presses forward to defend this towards cover
goes back and thwacks a length ball towards sweeper cover
flighted, and he defends this towards point. They thought about a quick single, but that went far too quickly to the fielder
hangs back in the crease, and cuts a length ball. It rises and drops just ahead of short third man
length, a bit wide of off, and he looks to cut this between point and short third man, but cannot find the gap
length, and he defends towards short midwicket
length, and he places this straight towards short midwicket
length, raps him on the pads as he shapes to flick this. Was going down the leg side with the natural angle of the incoming ball, though
shorter, outside off, and he can punch this wide of point towards the sweeper in the deep
length, and he punches this inside out. Pierces the infield, and will pick up two easily as the man at deep point does the cleaning up towards the short boundary
length, angles into him, and he places this to the right of point for a quick single
length, punches this towards cover
length, turns away from Sharma, who allows this to spin past his outside edge
goes back to convert a length ball into a short one, and smacks this over the short boundary at midwicket
presses forward to defend a length ball
flighted, outside off, and he drives this hard towards deep point. Brings up fifty for Rohit Sharma. Early life, but he has been quite superb since!
length, but wide outside off, and he can lean back and cut this away towards deep point
tossed up, and he waits on it and drives this with the turn away towards extra cover
length, but down the pads, and he can nurdle this down towards long leg
length, and he defends this towards short midwicket
length, a bit of shape in, and he blocks this, driving it towards cover
short, and he swings this towards wide long and gets a good hold of this! Is that the unshackling that he was badly seeking?
length, and he allows this to turn into him, makes some room on to the onside, and still flicks this away through midwicket. Almost makes the fence with the supreme timing on this!
length, just on off stump, and he punches this to cover
shimmies across to a full ball on off stump, and sweeps, but cannot beat short fine leg
stays back to cut a length ball from just outside off, and this is well stopped by Sabbir at point!
tossed up, and he drives this towards point as it grips after pitching
length, turns away from him, and he drives this towards deep point
length, holds it back a touch, at just 83kph, and he plays this to point
pulls out the sweep. Just one bounce on its way through to deep square leg
length, turns into him, and he drives this back towards the bowler. who fields to his right
full, on the leg stump, and he sweeps this to the right of long leg. Two runs to bring up India's 100!
length ball, doesn't turn as much as Rohit anticipates, but slow enough for him to punch this down the ground. Mosaddek dives to his right, but cannot prevent a single
full ball, on middle stump, and he swats it away towards deep square leg
length, turned away with the spin towards deep midwicket
uses his feet to chip down to a length ball, and drives this down to long on
OH, HELLO GORGEOUS! Full ball, and he just brings his bat down in a straight arc, starting from slips and down towards long on. Straight as a die, and just goes rocketing past the bowler
fuller, on the pads, and he flicks this towads midwicket. A sloppy bit of fielding allows it to go past the infield, and the two runs bring up fifty for KL Rahul!
fuller, outside off, and he looks to drive, but misses. Stifled half-appeal from Rubel, but that was too good for Rahul, actually!
slower ball, on the pads, and he waits inside the crease and drops it towards square leg. Easy single
straighter ball, and he walks across the stumps and flicks this away towards long leg. Trusts the bounce on this pitch
full, outisde off, and draws a terrifc cover drive from Rahul. A half-step to get to the pitch of the ball, and then just drives through the line. Superb!
length, but down the leg side, and he goes down on one knee and sweeps towards deep backward square leg
tossed up, straight ball, and he waits on it and flicks this away towards deep midwicket
length ball, and he allows this to turn into him, and eases this towards long on off the backfoot
tossed up, and he chips down the wicket and drives this to sweeper cover
flighted, and he drives this hard towards deep backward square leg. Didn't get a lot of timing on that
DOES THiS CARRY? Signs of the ball stopping, as Rahul mistimes an attempted drive down the ground. Might have just landed short of Mosaddek on the follow through
beaten! Good length at 137 kph/85 mph, Rohit flashes flat-footed at it on fifth stump and is late.
fullish length angled in on fourth stump, steps forward to push to point.

short on sixth stump, Rohit reaches a long way across to pull, drags this high and wide over wide long-on, not enough muscle to get to the rope though and it dribbles five yards short before being tracked down for a pair.
fullish length on off, stabbed back out past Rubel diving left, cut off at extra cover.
offcutter on fourth stump at 119 kph/74 mph, Rohit plays with soft hands guiding a single behind point.
short of a length on off, poked in front of point. Yes, no, yes between Rahul and Rohit but they agree to set off in the end and avoid disaster with slow reaction from the fielder.
good length ball on middle stump, Rahul backs away to create room accessing the off side, pushes this to the sweeper.
pulls out the nine-iron! Flighted on middle, chips this drive sky high over long-on, into the second tier.
short of a length on fourth stump, goes back and punches to long-on along the ground.
full on fifth stump, Rahul reaches across to flick through long-on.
full on middle, Rohit charges to turn this into an ankle high full toss, driven back to Mosaddek.

another skip to create a full toss at knee height, clubs this high and handsome over cow corner. Poor angle, not for the first time today, taken by Sabbir this time on the boundary turns two into four.
short of a length on middle, shuffles across to clip through square leg.
short on sixth stump, muscles another pull high over wide long-on, three bounces into the rope. Looks like the replacement bat has plenty of runs in store too.
fullish length on fifth stump, guides an open faced single to third man.
short of a length on sixth stump at 123 kph, goes back to defend down the pitch to Rubel.
good length ball but width on about 7th stump, late cut to third man.
short of a length on fifth stump, goes across to flick through midwicket for a tight run. Shakib with a shy at the non-striker's stumps misses but Rohit was in regardless.
dear Lord! The Rohit juggernaut cannot be stopped. Full on the stumps, Rohit just leans forward with a simple push and the ball sails back over Mustafizur's head into the sightscreen.
full on the legs, clipped gently behind square for a single.
good length ball on middle, goes back and edges this to third man.
full on middle, defended back to Mustafizur.
slower ball on the legs, short-arm jab pull fine past the keeper, weak relay from deep fine leg allows the second easily.
good length ball on off stump, Rohit with a gentle tap to third man with an open face to keep strike.
good length ball on the stumps, defended.
full and very wide, driven square to the sweeper.
short of a length on fifth stump at 131 kph/82 mph, some extra bounce from Rubel spitting off the pitch. Rahul awkwardly negotiates this in defense back down the pitch.
follows it with a slower ball on a good length on fifth stump at 112 kph, whipped straight to mid-on.
short of a length on sixth stump, Rahul cuts firmly behind point, sweeper with a lot of work to do and they come back for an easy pair.
short of a length on fifth stump, punches off the back foot to the sweeper.
good length ball on fourth stump at 119 kph/74 mph, punched off the back foot to extra cover.
good length ball on middle, punched on the front foot to long-on.
short of a length on fourth stump, punched off the back foot to extra cover.
good length ball on off stump, flicked through mid-on.
good length ball on off, flicked to midwicket in the ring.
bouncer over middle stump, Rahul misses a hook. No sound but lots of appeals, more in desperation than anything. No inclination from Mashrafe to go for DRS.
short on fifth stump, guided off the back foot to the sweeper.
fullish length on fifth stump, Rahul gropes forward away from his body and nudges into the off side.
short of a length on fourth stump and spins away a touch with very slow turn, flicks across the line into midwicket.
premeditates a shuffle well across his stumps, Shakib responds by angling this into leg stump, flicked through midwicket.
good length ball on middle, goes back to flick through midwicket.
good length ball on fourth stump, no turn, clipped wide of Shakib to his right but he scrambles to deny the run.
fullish length on fifth stump, leans into a drive but straight to the cover sweeper for one.
short on off stump, Rahul backs away for a flat-batted thwack back down the pitch short-hopping Soumya. Clearly not content with his role in a 170-run and counting opening stand....
fullish length wide outside off, goes back and across to cut hard straight to the cover sweeper.
bouncer on off, way over Rohit at 117 kph, doesn't even duck and it clears him by two yards.
short of a length on off, punched off the back foot to extra cover.
slower ball at 105 kph full and wide on sixth stump, driven square to the sweeper.
good length on fifth stump, shuffles across to punch to mid-on.
fullish length on fifth stump, pushed softly to cover.
nearly bowled him! Good length ball on fourth stump, Rohit goes back to punch and the ball stays low, the ball holds it's line on fourth stump though and just whispers past the stumps.
uses his feet to drive a full ball on off to long-off to move to 99.
uses his feet to a full ball on sixth stump, flicking to mid-on.
flighted on middle, pushed softly back to Shakib.

another 100 for Rohit! Short on sixth stump, flayed through cover to the sweeper. Fourth hundred in this World Cup, tying the record for one tournament with Sangakkara done in 2015. He takes his helmet off and salutes the crowd. He's not even close to being done.
short of a length on the hips, clipped wide of short fine leg and beats deep square leg too.

so much for all the talk of a double-hundred! Soumya strikes with his golden arm! Offcutter on fifth stump on a good length, Rohit mistimes a lofted drive over extra cover. Liton Das backpedals from the ring and takes a simple catch. The end of a fabulous knock and a brilliant opening stand.
good length ball on the legs, clipped through square leg.
fullish length ball on fourth stump, defended to midwicket.
good length ball on fifth stump, steps forward to defend to extra cover.
good length ball on fifth stump, defended to midwicket.
length, outside off, and he defends
short, and he hangs back and cuts this viciously. Won't beat deep point, though
length, and he drives this on the up. Just lands short of short midwicket
length, jags back into him, and he drops it at his feet and sets off for a quick single
length, and he chips it to the right of cover and gets a single
length, outside off, and he punches this to covers. Travels really fast, and that eliminates any thoughts of going for a run
length, outside off, and his bottom hand comes off as he tries to go inside out. Skews it in the air, past point, and the sweeper at the deep point fence cleans up
flicked off his hips to a length ball on off stump, as he shimmies across the stumps a touch. Gets it down to deep square leg
length, outside off, and he drops it as his feet. Wants a single, but Sarkar is quick to get to it on his follow-through
full, and he plays it away towards short midwicket
fuller, down the pads, and he can flick this away towards long leg. Enough running for the man to do there...two runs on offer
length ball, and he drops it just short of cover and sets off for a quick single
length, lifts off as it pitches and moves away from Kohli, as he shapes to drive. Close to the outside edge
full, and he drives this straight back past the bowler. Gun-barrel straight, and scorches through to the fence to the right of where long off might have been!
shorter in length, and he flicks this off the crease towards deep midwicket

GONE! No century here for Rahul, as he looks to slash away a ball that was a touch too full for the shot he was looking to play. Takes the outer edge - may have been a change of pace too - and drops away to Mushfiqur Rahim's right. He takes a good catch low down to his right. It's not Rahul's most fluent innings in international cricket, but the volume of runs should do his confidence a world of good. He was in control for a greater percentage while his partnership with Rohit Sharma was on, incidentally
lovely! Fuller ball, angles across him, and just eludes his outside edge as Pant looks to defend after stretching forward. Bowled at pretty decent pace too
length, straighter, and he walks across and flicks this towards deep square leg. Wants two, but will have to make do with just the single
floats one full, but sprays it down the leg side. Wide called
comes forward to meet a length ball, and forced to defend
length, turns into him after pitching on leg, and he defends
that's good! But not given. Will they review this? No. Length from around the wicket, and he looks to flick and gets hit on the pads. Maybe they aren't sure of the height
blocks a length ball angling into him towards square leg
TAKE THAT! Chips down the wicket and goes through with the full flow of the blade, and that sails into the stands beyond long on
plays a length ball off his pads towards deep midwicket
length, but down the pads, and he walks across and looks to flick this. Gets it off the pads towards fine leg

SHOT! Nothing more than just a defensive push to a fullish ball on middle stump. He brings his bat down in a slight arc, and that allows him to place this to the left of short midiwicket. it just hurries way towards the short boundary here at Edgbaston
length, and he punches this from the crease towards mid off
length, angles into him, and he taps it with a dead bat towards point and sets off for a quick single. Attempt at a direct hit at the striker's end from Mosaddek, but he would have been in anyway
length, angles away from him, and he steers it to point
slower ball, and he steers this past point towards third man. Should have been stopped by Mosaddek, but seems to have dived just over the ball
full, wide, and Pant almost over-hits an attempted drive down the ground! Skews it in the air, but inside out, and drops well short of sweeper cover
length, slants into Kohli, who drives this down towards long on
slower ball, and he eases it off his hips towards square leg
fuller ball, 125kph, and he digs it out towards deep backward square leg. Some running around for the two boundary riders, one of them behind square, and that allows them to come back for the second
fuller ball, and he flicks this away towards square leg
dug in short, and he drops it on the ground after rising to meet this just below his ribs. They go through for a quick single
tossed up, and on the stumps, and he whips this dismissively through midwicket. Supreme timing from Virat Kohli on that!
holds the length back a touch, and he can only play this away towards point
drives a full, straighter ball, with the slight turn away from him, towards long off
full, from around the stumps, and he plays more of a paddle shot, but so well timed! Down on one knee, stretching to get to the pitch of it
full ball, and he defends this
length, and he plays this with the turn to the right of square leg

oh, the fall-away sweep! It's a fuller ball, but too straight, and Pant gets down on one knee and plays that sweep that only he plays. Fine leg inside the ring, so gets it fine enough to beat that fielder
slower ball, straight, and he flicks this away towards midwicket. Picks up one
full, straight, and he flicks this to the right of deep midwicket. Two on offer easily
full, wide of off, and he drives it. It is uppish, but lands to the left of mid off
length, again down the leg side, and it almost arrives too slowly for Pant. Looks to flick it away, but misses out on contact
walks closer to turn this into a length ball on his pads, and flicks it away past short midwicket. Two runs easily picked up before there's a return from wide mid on
cutter, short of a length, and he defends this towards point

short, and he has holed out to midwicket! That cutter again from Mustafiz that does the trick. May have stuck in the pitch for a bit more than Kohli expected. He was aiming for that short boundary once again, and he placed it right down Rubel's throat. Kohli falls for the first time in six knocks without getting to at least 50!
fuller, angles away from him, and he presses forward to defend this towards point

TWO IN THE OVER FOR THE FIZZ! Mashrafe wants wickets out of Mustafizur in this situation, and how well has he delivered. Angles this on a good length, and wide slip comes into play. Pandya has a tentative poke, and it goes low to the left of Soumya Sarkar, who has made no mistake
length, a bit of movement away with the natural angle slanting away from Dhoni. He's having nothing to do with this
fuller, angles away from him, and he defends this towards cover
full ball, angles away from Pant, who defends from the crease
GORGEOUS! Full ball, just a bit of width, and he slaps this hard through covers. Not a great deal of foot movement, but keeps his base low and rifles this past cover
short, and he responds in kind! Cutter from Saif, and he waits on it and then swats it away towards deep midwicket. just a couple of bounces and through for four
THREE ON THE TROT FROM PANT! A bit of width outside off this time, and he whacks it past point. Superb timing too. Pant's on fire, safe to say...
length, and he whips this away towards deep square leg. Brings up 250 for India, and the early pillage means Dhoni can take his time in settling in
slower ball, outside off, and he pushes this towards sweeper cover
short outside off, slapped to wide long-off.
short on fourth stump and spinning in, goes back to chop a bottom edge behind point.
short on fourth stump, holds in the pitch, drags a pull to long-on.
short on fourth stump again spinning in, goes back and clips to midwicket.
short and wide, cuts to the point sweeper.
short on middle stump, goes back to punch down the pitch to Shakib.

shot! Fullish length angled in from off stump, Pant steps across and crouches to play a front foot pull flat behind square. Deep square leg tracks after it but it's tailing away the whole time to the rope.
bouncer on the stumps, way too short for Pant, called a wide.
short on fifth stump, goes for another front foot pull but picks out midwicket on the ring.
slower ball on the stumps, pulled behind square.
good length ball on off, punched to extra cover.
fullish length ball on middle, Dhoni goes back to whip through wide midwicket, long distance for Sabbir to cut it off and prevent four but he does get there in the end.
short ball on the stumps, Pant steps across and plays a short-arm jab pull behind square to keep strike.
short on off, clipped straight to short fine leg.
short and wide, chops a cut wide of Rubel at cover sweeper and they complete a pair.
good length ball on middle stump, prodded to midwicket.
good length ball on leg stump, flicked square of short fine leg.
good length ball on off stump and straightens, Dhoni reaches forward to poke it to point.
good length ball on fifth stump, Dhoni goes back as the ball keeps low and he chops a bottom edge toward point again.

short of a length down the leg side, misses a flick off the thigh guard, only a very delicate deflection and Mushfiqur with a fairly weak effort. The ball short-hopped him and wound up going off his gloves to the fine leg rope. Should've been stopped for a dot.
good length ball angled across Pant on fourth stump, follows the ball with his hands but is beaten past the edge.
slower ball on a fullish length on fourth stump at 118 kph, Pant takes an almighty heave and sends a light breeze toward the fans sitting beyond the rope at long-on.
good length ball on fifth stump, enough width to open the face and run a single to third man to get off strike.
fullish length on off stump, Dhoni with a flat-footed flick straight to midwicket.
Mahi says take that! Short on the stumps, the ball sits up for Dhoni to unleash a ferocious pull behind square. Bisects deep fine leg and deep midwicket with ease.

bobble and taken on the second attempt! Pant went for the slog sweep on a fullish length ball spinning in from fourth stump. He was going for the long boundary for the left-hander square of the wicket, didn't come close to getting enough power behind it. Mosaddek settled 15 yards in from the rope at deep backward square but produces a shaky effort reaching forward at neck height with palms facing out and fingers pointed up. It bursts through and actually deflects off his shoulder before popping up for him to take on the second effort.
good length ball on fourth stump, goes across to flick into a gap at midwicket.
flighted full on off, pushed awkwardly to extra cover.
good length but straying down leg, goes back to flick comfortably behind square.
beaten! Flighted full on fourth stump, Karthik reaches forward and it straightens to spin past the edge.
good length ball on middle, goes back to defend.
ooohhh shot! Good length ball on fourth stump angled across Dhoni, he uses the angle tailing away from him to create the width to cut beautifully behind point.

short of a length on off, punches to cover. Needless throw to the non-striker's stumps hits and ricochets through midwicket away from any backup fielder to allow for an overthrow keeping Dhoni on strike.
short of a length on off, goes across to flick behind square.
short of a length angled across fourth stump, late cut to third man.
short ball at 131 kph angled across, Dhoni swivel pulls behind square.

good length ball cut behind point, but diving stop to deny the run by Liton. Karthik wanted a run and was nearly sold out halfway down the pitch by Dhoni but Liton had trouble getting to his feet after the tumbling effort to produce a runout chance.
wide yorker on fifth stump at 125 kph/78 mph, Dhoni stabs this out behind point.
offcutter at 110 kph lands short on sixth stump, cut behind point and cut off by the sweeper.
full pace and full length on fourth stump, square drive to the sweeper.

overpitched on fifth stump, misfired the yorker only by a fraction and Karthik makes Saifuddin pay with an exquisite square drive to beat Shakib diving left at backward point. Third man up in the ring and it's an easy four.
full on the stump, clipped through midwicket for an easy single.
low full toss at shin height on sixth stump, Dhoni slices this to third man on the rope. Sloppy relay almost creates a chance for an overthrow before Dhoni decides against it.
full on leg stump at 127 kph/79 mph, flicked through to deep midwicket.

slow offcutter bouncer swallows up DK! It's that rubbery wrist of the Fizz ripping across the ball to throw off Karthik's timing on a short ball angled across on a fifth stump line. He tries to muscle a pull over the ring but the ball knuckles in the air toward Mosaddek at midwicket, who backpedals left and calls off mid-on to take a simple catch five yards inside the edge of the ring.
good length ball on fourth stump, guided into the off side to get off strike.
short ball angled across on fifth stump at 125 kph, left alone by Dhoni.
short of a length on fifth stump angled across at 124 kph, late cuts to third man.
short ball on leg stump at 132 kph, Bhuvi ducks under.
full and wide, driven wide of the cover sweeper for an easy pair.
vintage and sizzling! Overpitched on fourth stump, Dhoni hammers this in the air to the left of extra cover, too much heat on it for cover sweeper to have any chance of cutting it off.
wide yorker on 7th stump, Dhoni nubs a drive to extra cover and has no interest in running.
wide yorker on fifth stump, Dhoni premeditates a sweep to the medium pace but plays over the top of it.
slower ball gone wrong at 99 kph on fifth stump, too slow to fool Dhoni and he has plenty of time to adjust keeping his hands back before unfurling a corking drive through extra cover again.
fullish length on off stump, Dhoni premeditates to tap and run through cover looking to keep the strike for the final over.
short on off, flat bats this to long-off and turns down the single.
short and wide on sixth stump, Dhoni hammers a pull along the ground but picks out mid-on in the ring. Turns down a single once more.

short ball fetches another wicket for the Fizz! Bouncer at full pace at 137 kph on fifth stump, Dhoni tries to bully this over mid-on but is beaten for pace leaping on his toes, skies it over the umpire at the non-striker's end and it comes down safely into Shakib's hands jogging 20 yards left.
fullish length wide on fifth stump, Bhuvneshwar chops this into short midwicket, Mustafizur charges right but can't deny the single.
short on fourth stump, pulls to deep midwicket for one.

bouncer outside off stump left alone. Signaled a wide on the line by the umpire and they try to steal a bye. Mushfiqur underhands to Mustafizur in front of the stumps at the non-striker's end and he flicks on from a yard away with Bhuvneshwar two yards short.

five for the Fizz! Fullish length ball angled across sixth stump at 130 kph/81 mph, Shami shuffles across to try to create an angle into the leg side but only manages to drag onto the stumps. Just three runs in the over and three wickets to match.
length, angles across, and he leaves it
length, moves away from him and he defends
throws this a bit wider, and Tamim throws his bat at it. Moves away a bit and beats him outside off
fuller, a bit wider, and it goes along the outer part of the bat as Tamim looks to drive this down the ground. Runs away towards third man
length, nips away from outside off, and Sarkar looks for the wide. Not called, though
gets this one to nip back in! Good length, and the inward movement almost catches Sarkar by surprise, as he jams his bat down on it
full, towards off stump, and Tamim defends this towards short midwicket
length, angles across Tamim, who presses forward and defends this towards short cover
shorter, bowled at 139kph, and Tamim has to jump to defend this from the crease as it angles across him
full ball, and imperious! Too straight, and despite the presence of a short midwicket, Tamim gets into position for a flick, and gets it to zip to the left of the man stationed there
length, angles across him, bowled at 139 clicks, and he defends this towards cover
length, and a hit of width, and Tamim Iqbal at his best! Just stands up tall, opens his wrists up a bit and times this through the cover and point region
length, shapes back into him, and he defends
length, and outside off. He tries to drive this, but just cannot time it well. Is that a sign of how much this pitch has slowed up?
length, angles across Sarkar, who plays it with a dead bat down towards the slips
length, angles away from him, and he can steer this wide of the widish second slip down towards third man
OH DELIGHTFUL! Sourav Ganguly, on air, likens him to Saeed Anwar, as the ball is pitched a bit wide from Bhuvi, and he eases into a square drive. Just sheer timing
too straight, and he can flick this through the midwicket region. It will pull up ahead of the longer boundary on that end, and they will come back for two
full, outisde off, and he drives this towards mid off
OH WELL BOWLED! Bowled with the angle coming in, and it pitches and just moves a touch away from him, and beats both the outside edge and the top of off!
length, angles into him, and he defends this
length, angles into him at good pace, and he defends this
length, movement away, and beats the outside edge again. Sarkar looks to drive this straight down and misses the line completely!
length, angles into him, and he taps this towards point. Sets off for a single, and Tamim calmly sends him back
length, raps him on the pads as he shapes to flick, but was clearly pitching outside leg! Better line to bowl to Tamim, tucking him up
length, along the pads, and swinging back in and strikes him on the pads again. Going down leg, but much better!
length, angles across him, and raps him on the pads again as Tamim tries a hop, skip and flick. Goes off the top of his pads and goes towards the wide slip
length, angles across him, and he plays it towards short midwicket
length, and he leans into a drive. Gets it to the right of DK at mid off, and they set off for a quick single
short, and takes him by surprise! Well played in the end, as he takes his bottom hand off and allows this to run towards third man
length, outside off, and he drives this towards point. Well fielded by Hardik Pandya

length, and he plays it with soft hands, and sets off! Hardik Pandya has a shy at the stumps at the striker's end as Tamim Iqbal scampers home (just about) and they pick up overthrows, with no backing up
length, jags back in, but going down leg with the angle. Cranked up to 145kph by Bumrah!
length, slants into him, and he defends towards midwicket
dug in short, really short, and Dhoni is able to get his gloves to it and tip it over the bar towards fine leg. Just byes given, but that was quite close to being called wide. Tamim did duck, though
length, and he defends towards point. This was bowled at 144kph
length, and he whips it off his pads towards midwicket
dug in short, and goes along the leg side. The umpire allows it to pass as the natural angle takes it over the line of leg stump, as Tamim leaves
length, but on the pads, and he can wristily flick this toward the right of long leg. Two runs on offer before the fielder can send his throw in
length, and he drives towards short midwicket, who has moved a few yards closer to the bat now
dug in short, and he swings this around towards deep midwicket. Didn't time it well, but got it over the infield. Pant fields after chasing this down from mid on
length, angles across him as he shuffles across towards the off stump, but can only defend it straight back down the wicket
length, angles into him, and he defends towards midwicket
short, fast, and angles back into him at 144kph, and he defends awkwardly towards point
length, outside off, and he steers this to the left of third man. Two runs picked up before Pant can send his throw in
full, wide, and Sarkar slices this away over point. Calculated shot, with the open face of the bat to guide it square enough
wide of the crease, and he defends this length ball angling into him
length, outside off, and he defends this towards point
length, angles away from Tamim, and dips on Dhoni as he looks to drive this through the off side and misses. This was bowled at 138kph
length, on the pads, and he neatly tucks this away to the left of the square leg umpire
length, angles into him from around the wicket this time, and Sarkar blocks
slower ball, a cutter, along the pads, and he flicks this away towards deep square leg
length, but down the pads, and he can flick this away towards deep square leg
fuller, and he drives this towards midwicket. A slight lapse in fielding allows them to go through for the single
length ball, outside off, and he runs it down to third man
shorter, angles into him, Tamim takes off to flick this towards midwicket, but cannot pierce the infield. This was bowled at 142kph

GOT 'IM! Big wicket too, as Tamim Iqbal falls for the short ball follow-up by Shami. Stays rooted inside the crease as Shami pitches this further up. He plays it off the inside edge and chops it on to the stumps. Tamim was looking dangerous, and there will be no 2007 heroics from the left-hander for Bangladesh today
length, fast and angling into him, and he plays it down towards long leg with a neat, little flick of the wrists
length, outisde off, and he defends towards point
length, and he tries to guide this towards point, but cannot beat the infield
full on fourth stump, defended to extra cover, they think about a run before opting out.
sumptuous! fullish length straying on middle, Shakib prods this gently past Bumrah through mid-on but timed superbly and it races down the hill.
short of a length on the stumps, goes back to defend into midwicket.
slower ball on a fullish length straying on leg stump at 118 kph, holds his hands back to flick behind square.
short outside off on a sixth stump line, flayed in the air in front of point, two bounces to the sweeper.
bouncer well down leg, called a wide more due to the line than on height.

good length ball angled into leg stump, beats Shakib's attempt to flick through midwicket. The ball hits him above the knee roll and ricochets into the covers. No appeal for leg before as it's too high and going down leg.
fullish length on fifth stump, leans into a drive on the up piercing the gap between mid-off and extra cover.

huge appeal! Given not out! Fullish length pitching on off and angled into middle and leg, Soumya is beaten going onto the back foot to defend. Kohli takes 10+ seconds before calling for DRS. Looked like it was missing leg live. Will be very hard to overturn with Shami coming around the stumps. There's also some doubt as to whether Soumya has sandwiched this off an inside edge into his pads. Third umpire Aleem Dar deems there has in fact been an inside edge and doesn't even proceed past Ultraedge onto ball-tracking. India lose their review and Kohli is furiously remonstrating with Marais Erasmus on field.
short of a length on middle, tapped with soft hands into midwicket for a sharp run.
good length on fourth stump and straightening, Shakib dangles the bat on the back foot and is beaten.
good length ball angled in from fourth stump, defended to point.
short of a length on fourth stump, Shakib hops back to guide this to third man.
goes for the scoop straightaway and connects! Good length ball on leg stump, Shakib premeditates this somewhat and seizes the line clearing Pant with short fine leg in the ring.
good length ball on off and spinning in, defended on the back foot to midwicket.
fullish length on fourth stump, reaches forward to defend.
short of a length pitching outside leg, goes back and flicks past leg slip through backward square.
fullish length on fourth stump, Shakib goes deep in his crease to defend.
full on middle and off, goes back again to defend to midwicket.
fullish length ball on fourth stump, Soumya drives on the up and scoops this high over mid-off. Not timed that well but gets enough of it, one bounce over the rope.
good length ball on fifth stump, enough width to guide a single to third man.
very full on off stump at 141 kph, Shakib tries to flick through midwicket, leading edge goes straight to ground through to extra cover.
bouncer on off stump, Shakib ducks under with ease.
attempted yorker overpitched on leg stump, flicked off the toes through square leg.
short outside off on sixth stump at 140 kph, tennis racquet two-handed backhand swat over extra cover. Did Soumya spend the eve of the match down south at Wimbledon?
short of a length on leg stump and spinning down leg, Shakib backs away to flick behind square and misses.
good length on off stump spinning in, goes back and flicks through to long-on.

floated full on fourth stump at 77 kph, leans forward to defend, inside edge squirts behind square wide of leg slip for a run. Soumya collides a touch with Chahal attempting to field a relay at the non-striker's end.
fullish length on fifth stump, Shakib goes to sweep and miscues this into the ground toward midwicket.
very full on sixth stump, Shakib slog sweeps flat along the ground to long-on.
full and flat on middle stump at 86 kph, quickest ball of the over, goes back and clips through midwicket.
short ball first up, too high, wide on height.

half-tracker laced straight to extra cover! Very poor ball, short and wide angled across on sixth stump and going wider, sat up for Soumya to crank anywhere he wanted. He didn't keep it on the ground and didn't get the elevation either though. Kohli is standing 17 yards away on one of the used pitches on the square and latches onto this with a bunny hop reaching up at head height to his right. 7/10 on degree of difficulty coming at speed and at short range but a sitter for the Indian captain's standards.
short of a length on middle at 137 kph, defended back to Hardik.
fullish length on off stump, defended to short midwicket.
short of a length on off stump, goes back to defend to midwicket.
bouncer on leg stump at 137 kph, Mushfiqur is beaten hooking.
fullish length on fifth stump, drives away from his body, very thick edge goes fine to third man on the rope.
floated full on off stump, steps away to create room and drives to long-off.
flighted full on middle stump, tickled off a thin edge/glove prodding forward with some extra bounce spinning in.
flighted full on middle at 81 kph, drives a thick edge through point.
flatter and quicker a touch at 83 kph on middle and off, goes back to defend to midwicket.
floated a bit more on middle and off at the same speed, reaches forward to nudge this behind square.
very full on middle stump at 86 kph, pushed back to Chahal's left.
good length ball on fourth stump at 133 kph, opens the face to glide this fine to third man.
good length ball on off stump, Mushfiqur tries to glide this behind point but picks out the fielder on the ring.
short on fifth stump, pulled in front of square wide of midwicket for a lengthy two. Thought about coming back for three briefly but good work by the sweeper.
short ball on the stumps, pulled this time firmly to the man on the leg side boundary.
fullish length on fourth stump, drives at this and gets a thickish edge through where second slip might be. Goes fine past Dhoni and races to beat third man on the rope.
short on the body, pulled behind square to deep fine leg.
flighted full on off stump at 80 kph, goes for a slog and flubs this into the ground to midwicket.
flighted outside off at 75 kph, draws Shakib out of the crease to flick but straight to midwicket.
flatter on leg stump at 89 kph, Shakib goes back to flick through square leg.

flighted fullish on leg stump, flicked off the pads behind square. Fine leg ranges right and dives over the top of the ball to turn one into a boundary. Chahal with a double-tea pot staring at the fielder.
slog sweep is sweet! Flighted on off stump on a fullish length, Mushfiqur attacks against the spin but times this to perfection high over midwicket, three bounces over the rope.
flighted full on off, pushed into the covers off the front foot.
fullish length on fourth stump angled in and guided behind point. Mushfiqur wanted two initially as it was quite square of deep third man, but slipped while turning at the non-striker's end.
fullish length on fourth stump angled in from around the wicket, defended on the front foot to backward point.

short and wide outside off, cut behind point, cut off by third man for a pair to bring up the Bangladesh hundred to muffled cheers from the sparse Bangladesh fans scattered around Edgbaston. Heavily pro India crowd as expected.
short and wide, cut behind point but might tighter to the third man fielder this time around so they can only get one.
slower ball lands short on middle at 127 kph, Mushfiqur has to keep his hands back for a beat before continuing with a paddle pull behind square.
short of a length on fifth stump, cut behind point to the sweeper.
chips down the wicket, and mistimes a flick on to his boot. Luckily it doesn't go back to Dhoni
tossed up around off stump, and he flicks this away close to square leg
tossed up, he allows it to turn across him from off, and dabs this down towards short fine leg
fuller, and he can drive this past midwicket towards wide long on
goes back and cuts a length ball towards deep point
uses his feet to get closer to a length ball, and drives him down to long on
thrown wide, and he flays this through the point region. Hit so hard, gave third man really no chance of getting there!
length, angles into him, and he steers this late towards third man
fuller, wider, and he drives this past point towards the man in the deep
fuller, straight, and he ticks this off his pads towards Rishabh Pant at midwicket
short, and he rolls his wrists to keep a hook down. Goes to the left of long leg, and the fielder there chases this hard and keeps them down to just one
length, angles into him, and he flicks him from the crease towards deep square leg
length, turns into him, and grips a bit. He looks to flick, but gets a leading edge. It pops up, but lands short of the man at point, running to his left
fuller, and he thwacks this across the line towards deep midwicket
tossed up, turns away, and he leaves after watching this closely
length, and he waits, and then cuts this away backward of point. Played late, and beautifully met! Short third man chases, but in vain
fired in a bit wider, and he looks to cut this fine again, but cannot beat short third man this time

conventional sweep, but he cannot keep this down! Tossed up, and he goes for the slog sweep, but the bit of grip on this ball means it goes straight towards Shami at midwicket. Big wicket this for India to have plucked at this stage, just as the partnership was approaching fifty!
angles in from a length, and he flicks this down towards long leg
dug in short, and Das looks to have a nibble at this, but cannot reach it. That went at 142kph, and Das looks around to see if he can get a wide for that. No such signal
short again, and this time he withdraws his wrists well in time
length, and he plays it off off stump towards third man with an open face of the blade
length ball, outside off, and he steers it to third man
fuller, wider, and he can drive this towards deep point
flighted, and he drives, but cannot beat point
wrong 'un, spins in from outside off, and Das defends towards point
shuffles across and sweeps a length ball, picks out the man guarding the deep square leg fence
skips down the wicket, but ends up yorking himself. Can only drive this back towards Chahal
goes back and plays a wrong 'un towards midwicket
tossed up, and he can drive this with the turn towards wide long on
straight, length ball from around the wicket, and he can flick this towards deep square leg
length, outside off, and he punches this towards sweeper cover
full ball, and he shapes to flick but gets struck on the pads as that slants across him. A leg-bye towards square leg
full ball, on off stump, and he skews an intended drive towards mid on
short, and very good placement, and KL Rahul makes a super stop at deep square leg! Rolls his wrists to keep this down and get it well to the left of fine leg, but Rahul runs in and makes a good stop
taps a length ball down to third man for an easy single
length, and he punches this off the back foot past point. Easy two on offer as the man at deep point has to run to his left and field
length, and he cuts this hard, but cannot beat DK fielding at point

length, angling into him, and he punches this towards mid off. Bumrah needs to get a direct hit to put pressure on Das, but misses! What's more...there's nobody backing up close to the wicket, and they can come back for the second. Kohli isn't pleased one bit
length, punched towards point

short, cutter, and he uses the pace on offer to steer this past point and way to the right of Bumrah at third man. Easy two before Bumrah can complete that familiar 'hop, skip, jump and release' the ball routine
length, a bit of shape away from the bat. Das looks to drive, but is beaten by the late movement!
full ball, and he looks to flick this, but cannot make adequate contact. A bit of excitement from the bowler, but that was headed down the leg side
full ball, and he crunches this back down the ground, but Pandya does well to get his fingertips to it as it comes back at him on the bounce

short, slower cutter, and he waits on it and sends it out towards deep midwicket. Appeal for a run-out! Sent back, and just in time. That was to the right of Chahal, and to be fair, there probably were two in it, but Shakib hesisated a bit. Das had to quickly turn back and just about makes his ground with a dive
full, straight, and he drives this down to the left of mid on and takes off for a quick single

oh, lucky boundary! Length ball, and he flays this hard, but should have been stopped by Karthik. Hit one of the side pitches, and that may have thrown him off. Takes off, eludes Karthik and also beats mid off
cuts away a length ball, and calls for two towards deep point! Gets two, and that's another half-century for Shakib!
length, angles into him, and he places this between mid on and midwicket

length, down the leg side, and he flicks towards long leg. They go up for the run out as he comes back for two!. The throw was a quick one, but before Kohli could whip the bails off at the striker's end, Shakib had put in a dive, that saved him quite comfortably in the end. The Indians celebrate, but have to curtail it once they see the replays
length, and punched down the ground towards long off
length, but at the pads, and he can flick this away to the left of deep square leg
short, and he forces this away beyond midwicket. The man in the deep has to run around to his left, manning the longer portion of the ground, and that allows them to come back for two
dug in short, and he jumps away and places this to the right of fine leg. Excellent commitment from Pandya, who dives to his right, and relays that to the man from deep square leg!
length, and he looks to slap this across the line but misses. Rapped on the pads, but the angle and height counting against Pandya
PICK THE BONES FROM THIS ONE! It's no more than a length ball around off and middle, and he just whacks this on the up towards long on. Never intended to keep this down...never needed to!
length, and he flicks this away towards midwicket. Cannot beat the fieldsman there

SHORT BALL DOES THE TRICK! Pandya has two, as he digs this into the pitch, and Das takes him on with the pull, and can only get it as far as midwicket. Kohli is pumped as India make yet another inroad. The benefit of having played on this pitch only about 48 hours ago paying off with the Indians
short on fourth stump, goes back to guide this to third man.
short of a length outside off on sixth stump, slapped off the back foot to extra cover, fielded on one bounce.
good length ball angled into off stump, defended to backward point.
good length ball on fourth stump, guided well wide of slip to third man.
short of a length on sixth stump, too much width and he frees his arms to cut a bottom edge well wide of Dhoni, skittles through third man to the rope.
slower ball wide yorker on fifth stump at 104 kph, Shakib keeps his hands back barely to stab this out back to Bumrah.
fullish length on fourth stump at 142 kph, guided with soft hands to third man.
yorker on off stump at 146 kph, dug out to backward point.
short on fifth stump at 133 kph, goes to pull but miscues this into the pitch and fielded by Hardik in his follow-through.
fullish length angled down leg stump at 126 kph, flicked off the pads behind square.

slower ball on a fullish length wide outside off on 7th stump at 124 kph, Mosaddek struggles to keep the hands back, stabs a checked drive that loops over cover into no man's land before bouncing to the sweeper.
short on fourth stump, cut straight to backward point.
short on the stumps, pulled through midwicket hopping onto the back foot.
bouncer on off, bottom-edges this pull but the ball has the pace taken off and flutters into the ground about a foot in front of Dhoni.
yorker length on leg stump, flicked behind square.

drag on via the offcutter! Bumrah rolls his fingers over at 119 kph getting this to land on a good length on about a fifth stump line. Mosaddek wanted to run this with an open face down to third man but he's a touch out in front of the ball not accounting for the change of pace and the ball caroms off the inside bottom edge back onto the stumps.
edge first ball but no slip! Bumrah hustled him with a short ball, played awkwardly off the back foot but guided wide enough of Dhoni and plenty fine of third man to the rope.
follows the short ball with the yorker on middle stump, stabbed out.
good length ball on middle, defended to cover.
short of a length angled into leg stump, tries to flick this off his hips but is through the shot early, leading edge loops just wide of Bumrah going left in his follow-through.
short of a length angled into off stump, opens the face to run a single to third man. His wagon wheel is dominated there today. Hardly anything on the off-side in front of square.
slower ball at 122 kph lands on a fullish length on off stump, defended to extra cover.
short of a length drifting onto the legs, clipped behind square to deep fine leg.
short ball on fifth stump, tennis ball bounce at 127 kph and Shakib leaps to hook but misses.

the change of pace foxes yet another Bangladesh batsman! Fullish length at 122 kph, offcutter angled into middle and leg stump, Shakib was backing away to create room but couldn't keep his hands back enough to wait for the pace off the ball, checks his shot and the ball balloons off somewhat of a leading edge toward Karthik on the ring at extra cover. He takes three steps in and pouches the catch at thigh height. Bangladesh's semi-final hopes have been submarined by Hardik in this chase.
good length on off stump, goes back to defend at 130 kph and a thick edge flies short of point.
fullish length on middle stump, defended to midwicket.
Sabbir charges Bumrah, who drags the length back with a cutter at 120 kph and adjusts the line well outside off stump, Sabbir way out in front flailing with his head flying up.
attempted yorker on middle stump, dug out to mid-on.
full on the legs at 145 kph, clipped behind square.
good length ball on fifth stump at 143 kph, tries to run this to third man. Bottom edge just wide of off stump stopped by Dhoni. Identical shot that saw Mosaddek back to the pavilion.
short and wide way outside off, cuts straight to the point sweeper.
bouncer wide outside off, called a wide on height.

short on middle stump, pulled behind square. Deep fine leg runs across to cut this off, Bumrah. Instead of sliding he tries to reach down while in stride and makes a clumsy fumble knocking this over the rope. He's down on the ground now flat on his back and the physio sprints out.
fullish length on the stumps at 124 kph, defended back to Hardik.
short ball on fourth stump, leaps onto his toes to pull behind square, well wide of deep fine leg and they get an easy two.
slower ball full on off stump at 127 kph, defended back down the pitch.
short ball on off stump at 132 kph, flat batted pull to mid-on.
bouncer, ducked under with ease.
flighted full on sixth stump, driven to the cover sweeper.
flighted full on leg stump, clipped off the pads straight to the man at 45.
googly pitching on middle stump at 82 kph and spinning toward off, defended on the back foot back to Chahal.
good length ball pitching outside leg and spinning down. Not given a wide for some reason, was about six inches down leg and clearly missed the pads and everything.
good length ball on the stumps, flicked fine but straight to short fine leg once more.
good length ball pitching on middle, goes back to defend to midwicket at 77 kph.
short on the stumps, charged by Sabbir at 126 kph and swats this wide of mid-on, bounces away to the rope.
goes deep in his crease in response and Shami goes short on the body, gets inside the line and hooks this very fine past Dhoni.
short of a length on fifth stump at 139 kph, guided off the back foot to third man to bring up the 200.

Shami charged again, Saifuddin slogs this on the up from fourth stump and goes straight back over the bowler's head. Not timed cleanly but with mid-on up in the ring, it bounces away easily to the rope.
bouncer clears the batsman easily, but not too high to have to rebowl it.
length ball on off stump, heaved over wide mid-on. They're going after Shami and succeeding in a big way.
full and wide on fifth stump at 84 kph, driven square to the sweeper.

top-edge clears Bumrah at short fine leg! Went onto a knee to sweep a good length ball on leg stump. Not full enough to sweep and the extra bounce produces a top edge. Bumrah was caught flat-footed and a bit groggy having just returned to the field a ball earlier after getting a clean bill of health on his shoulder but couldn't backtrack to turn it into a chance.
full length ball but spinning well down leg.
full on off at 87 kph, clipped straight to midwicket.
good length ball on middle spinning into leg, goes back to flick but can't get it away.
short on fourth stump and spinning back in, chopped off the back foot to extra cover.
full and wide on sixth stump, Sabbir reaches a long way across to sweep this on length against the spin and hammers it along the turf through midwicket for a crisp boundary.
short on the stumps, scorching pull in front of square screams past the leg umpire to the rope.

missed runout off his own bowling! Short of a length on the stumps, goes back to tap this into the covers, Hardik pounces moving right, scoops, spins around and fires from 14 yards at the non-striker's end. Saifuddin was a dead duck by three yards but the ball bounces over the stumps.
short of a length on the stumps, clipped behind square for a very long one. Rahul denies the second.
slower bouncer wide on 7th stump at 127 kph, tries to uppercut this but misses.
fullish length ball follows Saifuddin backing away down leg, can't get it away off the pads.
slower bouncer on fifth stump, left alone by Saifuddin.
full, looks for the sweep, but misses
goes down the leg side with a flatter one, bowled at 91kph, will have to rebowl this
goes back to tap a length ball back towards short midwicket. Chahal is first to it

floats this one wider of off stump, and Sabbir wants to go hard at it. Misses, as the ball creeps under his bat, and he falls over. Just about stays inside the crease, as Dhoni lurks looking to effect the stumping
pushes a length ball away towards sweeper cover
googly, and he allows it to turn into him, and plays it away towards square leg. They want two, but Chahal gets there first. Superb commitment, as he puts in a dive to throw this to Dhoni
flighted, outside off, and he drives this down to long off
fuller ball, angles into him, and he plays this away to the left of square leg
around the wicket, full, and he smacks this inside out! Saifuddin with a more than sufficient sting in the tail today!
length, angles into him, and he pushes this back down the pitch
walks closer to a ball outside off, and whips it away towards long leg. Targets the shorter boundary, and that's where this goes!
short, and he plays what Kapil Dev had popularised as the Natraj shot! One foot up in the air, as he pulls it away towards deep square leg
short, and he swings away to the on side. Goes off the underside of the bat towards square leg, and they pick up a single
length, a bit wide, and he slashes hard, but gets it towards a protected fence at deep point
fuller ball, and he digs it out towards deep midwicket
tossed wide. Too wide in fact, outside off, as he leaves
nails the yorker. Bowled at 136kph, and Sabbir plays it on to his boot. Wants a quick single, but it fell far too close to the wicket, with Bhuvneshwar running in quickly
slower ball, outside off. He advances, but misses on contact. Wide called again!
length, and he looks to run this down towards third man, but gets it too close to short third man. A change-up again from Bhuvi
length, outside off, and he looks to play the steer towards third man again. This time it was 122kph, as he is beaten by the pace of it. A bit early, in fact
full toss, on middle and leg, and he flicks it away but gets it to deep midwicket

GOT HIM! Fullish, and a change of pace at just 118kph. Sabbir swings free, but cannot make any contact with this. It goes on to just brush the leg stump after missing his flashing blade. That has the ring of 'game, set, match India' all over it!
yorker, on off stump, and he digs it out. That went at 142kph
full ball, and he flicks it away towards midwicket
full ball, and he flicks this away towards deep midwicket
full, and he plays it away towards square leg
goes wide with a slower ball, but too wide of the tramlines on the off side
yoker, and he has timed this beautifully through the on side. Deep midiwcket has to trudge to his right and get this. 250 up for Bangladesh!
SMACKED HIGH AND STRAIGHT! Change of pace from Bhuvi, and Mortaza gets a lot of height as he targets the straight boundary, but only just clears the man there

ANOTHER ONE BITES THE DUST! Goes for another straight thwack, but the outside edge sends it flying to the right of Dhoni, who takes it safely. Bangladesh's campaign is approaching its end, but they aren't going down without a fight here
slower ball attempted, ends up as a leg-side full toss, but Rubel can only play it away towards square leg
short, and he backs away and looks to swipe this straight down the ground. Gets the outer edge as it flies to the right of third man
slower ball, just down the leg side as Saifuddin looks to play the flick. Called a wide again
backs away and pumps a full ball through extra cover. What a super bit of timing!
off cutter, change of pace, and he can flick this away towards midwicket and pick up a single to retain strike
slower ball, a full toss, and he is surprised by how high it comes to him. Tapped away to point. He's looking for the full toss above waist height, but it isn't called
full ball, and he drives this down the ground to long off
DRILLED BACK DOWN THE GROUND! I think Rubel will get the broadcasters to give him this clip for his archives. Gets down on one knee and slaps a full ball outside off back past Bumrah
backs away from a short ball, and sends it flying towards point. Rishabh Pant decides not to attack the ball
full, angles across Saifuddin, who flicks this towards midwicket, and gets an easy single
yorker, and he jams his bat down just in time to keep this 143kph ball away from his stumps. Runs it off the inner part of the bat down to fine leg
full, just outside off, and Rubel looks to go down the ground, but misses out
full toss, and he puts in a lot of effort to whack this away. Eventually off the toe-end and back past Saifuddin at the non-striker's end, and goes towards long on
short, and Saifuddin lets this pass. Too short, and is called a wide
short, follows him as he backs away, and he can still connect and get it down to long leg. Terrific shot!
full ball, and he drives this down towards long on
full ball, just outside off, and he tries to slap this away after backing away to the leg side, but cannot make contact
full again, and he gets an inner edge in trying to thrash it down towards long on. Limps down the leg side, for Dhoni to take
full, and he whips this off middle stump towards midwicket
backs away and gets a bit of bat to a length ball angling into him, goes towards midwicket

WHAT A SHOT TO BRING UP FIFTY! It's a full ball, on the stumps, and he backs away and smacks this straight back down the ground. Long on gets around and dives to his right, but Virat Kohli can only just miss the ball there
fullish ball, at the pads, and he gets some bat to it and runs it along to square leg

YORKED HIM! Full, fast, and gives no chance to Rubel Hossain. He backs away yet again, but this time the angle of the ball gives him no chance to jam the bat down in time. Bangladesh are running out of wickets, but what an absolutely fantastic rearguard action it has been since Shakib fell!

THROUGH HIM! That's how it's done, says Jasprit Bumrah. From one exponent of great death bowling to the other! That went through Mustafizur before his bat could even contemplate its descent down to meet with the ball. Goes through between the bottom the bat and his toe, and goes on to hit the base of off-stump.
